data.nodeName: Delta Goodrem Matthew Copley TV wedding
data.pageTitle: Delta Goodrem’s fairytale TV wedding plans REVEALED

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Ever since former *The Voice* coach Delta Goodrem went public with her guitarist boyfriend Matthew Copley in 2017, speculation about the pair's impending nuptials has been the talk of the town.

For years, the pop princess has teased fans and hinted about her big day with a possible Byron Bay location, a Cerrone ring, a J'Andreatta dress and VIP guest list. 

But now a top TV insider tells *Woman's Day* every detail of Delta's wedding could soon be revealed... and we're all invited! 

Taking to social media in December, Delta, 36, announced she had launched her [own production company](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/the-voice/delta-goodrem-the-voice-2021-not-returning-66166|target="_blank"), Atled Productions, with her "long-time partners and friends" at Nine. 

"This has been a dream for a very long time, and I'm so excited to share that I've launched my own production company," she gushed.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
While her first major project was her festive special, *Christmas With Delta*, which saw the songwriter performing her favourite carols, *Woman's Day*'s insiders insist her next move could be a TV wedding spectacular! 

"There's talk Delta will self-produce a fly-on-the-wall documentary series following the lead-up to her wedding and, of course, the extravagant ceremony," says a source who reveals it would "sit perfectly at the network, which would jump at the chance to air a TV wedding special". 

"As Australia's sweetheart she's got incredibly loyal fans and was able to lead *The Voice* for almost a decade. There's definite interest and she's got an incredible story... It would make perfect viewing and be a ratings hit!"

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Now, close friends tell *Woman's Day* there's every chance the special program could be well into production, with speculation [Delta and Matthew](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/celeb-news/delta-goodrem-boyfriend-matthew-65970|target="_blank") already said 'I do' over the new year. 

It comes just after Delta's best friend and former *The Voice* co-host Renee Bargh, 35, appeared to have held a secret hens night for the singer at Sydney's Opera Bar.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Alongside a girlfriend called Jacqui, Renee and Delta stunned at the popular location for a night of "celebrations". Renee later posted a shot of herself posing in front of a "Love Bus", reportedly in Byron Bay.

Certainly, a TV wedding is not uncommon for celebs, with Kim Kardashian, Mario Lopez and Carmen Electra also streaming their big days on the small screen.

[**Want to find your own fairytale romance? Sign up to eharmony today!**](https://tms.eharmony.com.au/cl?m315=c&q=rwQZItJzuQsjXDgfwAt08kCw%7Ctarget=%22_blank%22|target="_blank")

data.contentTitle: Delta Goodrem’s fairytale wedding! Could the singer say ‘I do’ in a special television event?
data.pageMetaDescription: After launching her productions company at Nine and Insider tells Woman's Day Delta Goodrem may be planning her TV wedding to Matthew Copley.

data.nodeName: I'm a celebrity get me out of here Australia contestants 2021
data.pageTitle: I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here Australia: Every contestant for 2021

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
The year 2020 has thrown a fair few curveballs at us, but some things will never change. 

That being, we'll still celebrate Christmas, the sun will rise again tomorrow, and... *I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!* goes ahead for its 2021 season - rain or shine.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Yep, long time fans of the hit reality show were [thrilled to hear the next season is going ahead](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/im-a-celebrity-get-me-out-of-here/im-a-celeb-2021-behind-the-scenes-secrets-66345|target="_blank") as planned back in 2020.

Of course, a few tweaks were necessary given the fact it's usually filmed in a jungle deep in South Africa. 

Given the *teeny* problem that international travel is all but off the cards, the filming location for 2021 was ever so slightly in question. 

That is until we were reminded we have a rather epic backyard here in Australia, and the new series could go ahead in the exact same format, just in a different less-jungle-more-outback kinda spot.

Now, after the new season premiered on January 3, we got our first glimpse of everyone going into the jungle. 

From Abbie Chatfield to Grant Denyer, [we've got quite the season](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/im-a-celebrity-get-me-out-of-here/im-a-celeb-2020-jamie-oliver-66052|target="_blank") ahead of us - we round up the celebs who have entered the jungle already, and those that are rumoured to be joining the clan! 

**Keep scrolling as we look at the possible cast list for *I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!* for 2021!**

data.contentTitle: Abbie Chatfield and Jack Vidgen walk into a jungle... Here's a roundup of every celeb (and all the rumoured ones!) starring on I'm A Celeb 2021

contentGallery.title: Grant and Amanda
contentGallery.caption:
**Grant Denyer and Amanda Keller**

The hosts have become the contestants. While Grant made his debut on Sunday night, according to *TV Blackbox*, Amanda Keller is also rumoured to be joining the clan in the jungle.

contentGallery.title: Travis Varcoe
contentGallery.caption:
**Travis Varcoe**

Former AFL player (Collingwood, to be specific) and winner of two premierships, Travis Varcoe is sure to bring his athletic A-Game to the jungle.

contentGallery.title: Colin
contentGallery.caption:
**Colin Fassnidge**

Apparently, the former *My Kitchen Rules* host was a last-minute replacement of controversial chef Pete Evans who was axed from the show mere hours before filming was due to begin.

contentGallery.title: Jess Eva
contentGallery.caption:
**Jess Eva**

Jess was the host of a radio show before going on *The Block* in 2018 - wonder how her third stint in the limelight will go for her...

contentGallery.title: Mel Buttle
contentGallery.caption:
**Mel Buttle**

Mel is a comedian known for her work on *Please Like Me* and *The Drum* - but you may also recognise her for her cooking (or tasting, more accurately) prowess on *The Great Australian Bake Off*.

contentGallery.title: Pettifleur Berenger
contentGallery.caption:
**Pettifleur Berenger**

Are those ruffled feathers we hear? This *Real Housewives of Melbourne* star is sure to add some drama and flair to the jungle.

contentGallery.title: Ash Williams
contentGallery.caption:
**Ash Williams**

Aussie comedian, podcaster and host, we're sure Ash Williams will provide all the laughs in the Aussie jungle, not to mention some reported romancing when it comes to a certain contestant.

contentGallery.title: Abbie Chatfield
contentGallery.caption:
**Abbie Chatfield**

*Bachelor* villain turned hero, Abbie Chatfield has been gaining momentum as an Instagram influencer, podcaster and more. And, now, she's braving the jungle, apparently finding love with Ash Williams along the way.

contentGallery.title: Robert 'Dippa' Dipierdomenico
contentGallery.caption:
**Robert 'Dippa' Dipierdomenico**

*TV Blackbox* reports that the ex-AFL star 'Dippa' is headed for the jungle. Let's hope he's also inducted into the I'm A Celeb Hall of Fame after the show ends.

contentGallery.title: Toni Pearen
contentGallery.caption:
**Toni Pearen**

She's known as a singer, TV presenter and former *E Street* star; get ready to see Toni Pearen undergo some tucker trials this Jan.

contentGallery.title: Adam and Simon from Gogglebox
contentGallery.caption:
**Adam and Simon from Gogglebox**

Aussies were saddened to see this dynamic duo leave the Gogglebox couch, but now Adam and Simon are headed for our screens once more. Except, this time, people will be reacting to them!

contentGallery.title: Paulini Curuenavuli
contentGallery.caption:
**Paulini Curuenavuli**

In November, *[The Daily Mail](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-8957637/Im-Celebrity-Australia-filming-gets-underway-Jack-Vidgen-Paulini.html|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow")* reported singer Paulini Curuenavuli was one of the stars headed into the jungle, with sources telling the publication she was one of two people who'd arrived at the campsite.

contentGallery.title: Jack Vidgen
contentGallery.caption:
**Jack Vidgen**

The second? Only Jack Vidgen, a former *Australia's Got Talent* star and talented singer. We can't *wait* to see if the rumour is true...

data.nodeName: Bump Nathalie Morris Carlos Sanson Jr
data.pageTitle: Bump stars Nathalie Morris & Carlos Sanson Jr spill on the show

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
*Love My Way* was one of those iconic Aussie television series that will forever hold a place in our hearts. 

So, when we heard the creators of the hit series were back with a new original show for Stan, *Bump*, our hearts almost burst with excitement. 

The [10-part original series](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/tv/netflix-australia-january-2021-66316|target="_blank") centres around Oly (played by Nathalie Morris), an ambitious and high-achieving teenage girl who suddenly finds herself in labour despite being completely unaware she'd fallen pregnant. 

The drama series stars Claudia Karvan who leads as Oly's mother and also acts as a producer of the series. Angus Sampson (Fargo) also appears in the heartwarming series as well as up-and-coming stars, Nathalie Morris and Carlos Sanson Jnr who plays her baby daddy, Santiago. 

We chat to the rising stars, Nathalie and Carlos about the drama that's sure to find its way into your heart, too.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
**Tell us about your characters…**

**Nathalie**: Oly's a whip-smart, determined year 11 student, with a very clear vision of her future. She's motivated by great female leaders, like Jacinda Ardern, and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, and she manages to ignore most of what's going on in her personal life because she's so set on achieving her long-term goals: to study at Harvard and work for the UN. Oly gives birth to a surprise baby in the first few minutes of the show, and this shock arrival kicks off a wild chain of events that forces her to face up to the uncomfortable, scary, thrilling, chaotic parts of her life, step outside of her comfort zone, and find out what she's really made of. 

**Carlos:** Santi is a creative trapped in a jock's body, he is a boy's boy, a talented football player, and cheeky at times but his passion lie's in the arts. Deep down, Santi is a romantic, and he uses his art as an outlet to express his feelings. In particular, the feelings he doesn't quite know how to articulate.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
**How do you relate to a teen going through such an ordeal so you can play that on screen? **

**Nathalie:** I've never experienced something as shocking as unexpected labour, but I've always put very high expectations on myself and I've had to deal with curveballs and come to terms with unexpected new realities. That's one of the things I love most about the show - it's celebration of mistakes, awkward moments, and bizarre behaviour.

I couldn't relate to the motherhood aspect of the show at first, but there were so many mothers in the cast and crew that shared their hilarious -  and horrifying - stories with me throughout the shoot and showed me how to hold a baby, breastfeed, change a nappy etc. - those conversations were actually one of the greatest parts about being in this production.  

**Carlos: ** Santi and I are very very similar, sometimes you hear people talk about how they were born to play certain roles. It definitely feels that way for me, especially when I look at the parallels between Santi and I. We were both born in Australia with Chilean parents, we both love football, we both got into trouble at school, we both follow our creative pursuits (mine acting, his art), and to be honest, we are both sensitive guys…yes it's true, I like to think I'm in touch with my emotions. 

I think the biggest difference between us is Santi's naivety. He is younger, still in school, and in a way sheltered from the real world. That is until of course he is forced to deal with adult problems (like raising a baby). I guess he's got the baby department over me!

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
**You both have to film a few intimate scenes, not just with one another, what's it like filming those?** 

**Nathalie:** We had the incredible Danielle Micich as our intimacy coach and she worked with each director in rehearsals to choreograph very distinct and honest sex scenes. Sometimes we felt the urge to laugh to break the awkwardness but she urged us to stay only in relationship with each other during those scenes and not with anyone else in the room. 

**Carlos:** It was something I had never done before so it was a really interesting process, and a great learning experience. We had an intimacy coach for rehearsals and on set, who, much like choreographing a fight scene, guided us through movements, boundaries, places we could touch, places we couldn't. It was all about supporting your scene partner with what they felt comfortable with, communication was key.

data.contentTitle: Bump stars Nathalie Morris & Carlos Sanson Jr spill on the heart-warming drama that’s sure to be your new obsession
data.contentSummary: Get ready to fall in love with the new show.

data.pageTitle: Samantha Armytage marries Richard Lavender in romantic New Year's Eve ceremony

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
As the sun sets on 2020, Samantha Armytage is seeing out the turbulent year by marrying the love of her life. 

The *Sunrise* star wed partner Richard Lavender in a small and intimate ceremony in front of a select group of immediate family on Richard's sprawling 40-hectare property in the stunning Southern Highlands region of Bowral in NSW on Thursday.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
[In photos obtained by the *Daily Mail Australia*](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-9101027/Samantha-Armytage-wears-white-satin-high-neck-dress-weds-Richard-Lavender.html|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow"), Sam stuns in a mod-inspired white bridal dress, reportedly by Australian designer Carla Zampatti, which features long sleeves and a sleek silhouette. 

She wore her blonde tresses in a modern half-up, half-down style and accessorised her look with a chic white ribbon.

Meanwhile the groom, who runs his own equestrian business, cut a dapper figure in a classic suit and tie combo. 

At the small reception lunch, Sam's father Mac reportedly sat at the head of the table while other guests included Sam's brother Charlie and Richard's daughters Sasha and Grace, [the *Daily Telegraph* reports.](https://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/nsw/sam-armytage-to-marry-richard-lavender-in-southern-highlands/news-story/30f8dad1c5086f4bdb45017517008831|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow") 

In a sweet touch, Sam's Labrador Banjo was also in attendance at the wedding ceremony, which took place at 12pm. 

[**READ NEXT: Everything you need to know about Samantha Armytage's new husband, Richard Lavender**](https://www.newidea.com.au/samantha-armytage-everything-you-need-to-know-richard-lavender|target="_blank")

content.caption: Ringing in the New Year as husband and wife! A huge congrats to Samantha Armytage and Richard Lavender, who have officially tied the knot.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
According to [*news.com.au*](https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/celebrity-life/inside-sam-armytages-intimate-wedding-with-richard-lavender/news-story/015f54dee760032253d0a9c537448e7c|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow"), the bridal party headed to nearby Centennial Vineyards Restaurant for their wedding reception. The outlet also claims Sam and Richard always wanted a low-key and small affair, which has worked out for the best as Sydney faces a second COVID-19 outbreak.  

Sam and former farmer Richard, 61, are said to have met at socialite Skye Leckie's 60th birthday party in April last year.

Since the pair started dating, their romance has gone from strength to strength.

[**Want to find your own fairytale romance? Sign up to eharmony today!**](https://tms.eharmony.com.au/cl?m315=c&q=rwQZItJzuQsjXDgfwAt08kCw%7Ctarget=%22_blank%22|target="_blank")

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
In September last year, [Sam was introduced to Richard's daughters](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/celeb-news/samantha-armytage-boyfriend-daughters-58223|target="_blank") Grace and Sasha over an intimate family lunch for his 60th birthday celebrations.

Richard had been dating casually since he split from his wife around two years ago, but Sam is the first serious relationship he's had.

Speaking to *Who* magazine on her blossoming romance, Sam said one of the things she liked the most about her partner was the fact that he had "no idea" who she was when they first met.

content.caption: The happy couple hit it off after meeting at mutual friend Skye Leckie's 60th birthday party in April last year.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
However, after several weeks of getting to know each other, Sam confessed that she finally encouraged Richard to watch *Sunrise* – just so he could find out what she did for a living.

[The journalist announced her engagement back in June](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/celeb-news/samantha-armytage-engaged-64338|target="_blank"), posting two loved-up snaps on her socials, showing off her gorgeous new diamond sparkler.

"What a year..." Sam captioned the photos, which appear to be taken in the NSW Southern Highlands, where both Sam and Richard own multimillion dollar properties.

[Appearing on *Sunrise* for the first time after the news broke](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/celeb-news/samantha-armytage-engagement-ring-64356|target="_blank"), Sam shared all the gorgeous details of the proposal live on-air.

The journalist explained the proposal was a very thoughtful albeit understated affair on her Southern Highlands property in NSW.

"We just had a little bonfire on the weekend in the paddock, it was all very low-key. Like Rich and I, very low-key," she said.

Sam later added: "We'd been picking weeds in the paddock and he said, 'Darling, do you want to marry me?'

"It was very sweet, very romantic. He's just a very charming, lovely fellow."

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Before she met Richard, [Sam dated a sling of high profile men over the years.](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/celeb-news/samantha-armytage-ex-boyfriends-64340|target="_blank")

"I've always dated dangerous guys, maybe — but I don't need that now," she told *Sunday Life* in 2014.

"The types of blokes who ask me out are overly confident types, always good looking and sometimes footballers — the badly behaved ones."

Sam's fairytale wedding comes after a heartbreaking period for the star, [who lost her beloved mother Elizabeth "Libby" Armytage](https://www.who.com.au/samantha-armytage-mum-libby-death|target="_blank") following a long-term battle with an autoimmune disease in November.

"My parents love him. Both our families get on very well – it's a very happy union," Sam revealed before her mother died.

A huge congratulations to Sam and Richard, wishing you a lifetime of happiness.

data.contentTitle: Ringing in the New Year as a Mrs! Samantha Armytage marries Richard Lavender in an intimate ceremony on the Southern Highlands
data.pageMetaDescription: A huge congrats to Sunrise star Samantha Armytage, who has wed partner Richard Lavender in an intimate New Year's Eve ceremony on the Southern Highlands. Get all the exciting details!

data.nodeName: I'm A celebrity get me out of here reactions 2021
data.pageTitle: The best I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here reactions from the 2021 premiere

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
When *I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here* Australia premieres on TV every January, a captivated, reality TV deprived audience awaits to watch with much vigour. 

Yes, the show itself is filled with plot twists, ridiculous challenges, and moments we never thought we'd see play out on TV, let alone involving some of the country's beloved celebs, but that it does. 

And usually, the people have plenty to say about it.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
On Sunday evening, the show premiered its 2021 season, with a host of Aussie celebs - some of whom you'll definitely recognise in an instant, and some you *might* have to do a quick Google to find out (or, simply [check out our cast list here](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/im-a-celebrity-get-me-out-of-here/im-a-celebrity-get-me-out-of-here-australia-contestants-2021-66072|target="_blank")). 

In a whirlwind of helicopters and skydiving extravaganzas, we met our first nine contestants, with another set to be added to the ranks. 

As they arrived at camp and [met their comrades](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/im-a-celebrity-get-me-out-of-here/im-a-celeb-2021-behind-the-scenes-secrets-66345|target="_blank") for the first time, the usual guessing game of who-knows-who was rampant.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
But almost even more entertaining to watch was seeing how the cast, and the show's introduction played out on Twitter. 

Yep, you can bet Australia took to the social media platform to voice their thoughts on everything - from Abbie Chatfield's beauty regime to the *real* icon of the show (this year, it's not Julia Morris or Chris Brown...). 

Keep scrolling as we round up the best Tweets and memes from the premiere episode of the show.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content: It all started with a clear cut obsession with Abbie Chatfield, former *Bachelor* favourite and a queen of social media, so to say.

data.nodeName: prince harry meghan markle website archewell
data.pageTitle: Prince Harry & Meghan Markle's new website Archewell EXPLAINED

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Almost a year after Prince Harry and Duchess Meghan formally stepped back as senior royal family members, the outlook has changed *quite* a lot. 

On January 8 in 2020, they made the initial announcement that sent shockwaves through the world. 

Then came a significant decision to leave the UK and resettle in the United States in March, where they began isolating in Los Angeles amid the COVID-19 pandemic. 

A few months later, they purchased their dream home in Santa Barbara, relocating there with their one-year-old son Archie. 

On the surface, they seemed quiet, subdued, and private - but behind the scenes, something big was brewing.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
After formally stepping back, the pair announced they would be [launching their own charitable foundation](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/royals/british-royal-family/harry-meghan-podcast-archie-66340|target="_blank"), which would act as an umbrella to their exisiting patronages as royals, as well as their new projects. 

It's name? Archewell. 

As 2021 kicks off, the pair have now revamped the foundation's website, giving fans a deeper understanding of they have planned. 

We've broken down everything we think you need to know about Archewell.

contentBody.label: Heading
contentBody.content: 1. There's a focus on motherhood

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
*I am my mother's son.*

*And I am our son's mother.*

*Together we bring you Archewell.*

These are the lines to be met with when visiting the Archewell website. 

Harry and Meghan's reference to Princess Diana is clearly a sign that their foundation is about compassion, giving and care - all things the late Princess was most famous for. 

Each of these qualities also [embodies some of the key roles](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/royals/british-royal-family/harry-meghan-archewell-jose-andres-world-central-kitchen-66305|target="_blank") a mother plays in her child's life. 

The pair clearly have big plans to bring care and hope to a new generation.

contentBody.label: Heading
contentBody.content: 2. There's an unseen photo of Meghan and her mother, Doria

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
On the homepage, a picture of Prince Harry and Princess Diana headlines the background alongside another gorgeous childhood photo of Meghan Markle. 

In the image, she and her mother, Doria Ragland, are seen embracing. 

This marks the very first childhood photo Meghan has publicly released, and provides fans a sweet insight into her childhood growing up in Los Angeles.

contentBody.label: Heading
contentBody.content: 3. Meghan and Harry have made a number of partnerships already

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
On the Archewell website, their key partnerships are listed, giving fans an insight into what kind of work and projects we can expect to see. 

These include, James R. Doty's Center for Compassion and Altruism Research and Education, Tristan Harris' Center for Humane Technology,  Dr Safiya Noble and Dr. Sarah T. Roberts' UCLA Center for Critical Internet Inquiry, and José Andrés' World Central Kitchen.

contentBody.label: Heading
contentBody.content: 4. Their new podcast, Archewell Audio, is featured

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
In December, we learned of the launch of Archewell Audio, which is a Spotify podcast hosted by Harry and Meghan. 

They released their first podcast just before the new year, with a very special guest in their very first intro - baby Archie! 

In the rewind-repeat-many-times-over moment, the pair are heard teaching Archie to say Happy New Year, followed by all three of them breaking into giggles. 

The holiday-themed episode also featured cameos from singer Elton John, producer and actor Tyler Perry, tennis champion Naomi Osaka and other big-name stars all reflecting on 2020 and their hopes for the year to come.

contentBody.label: Heading
contentBody.content: 5. There's more information about their Netflix partnership

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Harry and Meghan have also partnered with Netflix, bringing a visual element to their charitable work. 

In the explainer section of the website, the Duke and Duchess explain the productions will inform, elevate, and inspire. 

"Through its creative partnership with Netflix — the world's leading streaming entertainment service with more than 195 million members—Archewell Productions will utilise the power of storytelling to embrace our shared humanity and duty to truth through a compassionate lens," the statement explains.

data.contentTitle: Unseen photos and a stirring message to the public: 5 things to know about Prince Harry and Duchess Meghan's revamped website, Archewell
data.contentSummary: The Duke and Duchess have been working on the umbrella foundation since stepping back as senior royals.
data.pageMetaDescription: After formally stepping back as royals, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have launched Archewell, their charitable foundation, kicking off with a brand new website.

data.pageTitle: Jasmine Stefanovic reveals baby Harper's huge new milestone

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
We've basically been following Harper Stefanovic's every adorable move since she made her exciting grand entrance into the world as Karl and Jasmine Stefanovic's first child together. 

Now, those moves are picking up pace with baby Harper reaching an exciting new milestone that's sure to see her literally moving all over the place! 

Taking to Instagram Jasmine shared a sweet video of the bub officially crawling to the classic tune of rapper Cardi B's *Rollin*.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
And she looked to be loving her new ability. 

Any new parents will know this means [Karl and Jasmine](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/parenting/celebrity-families/karl-stefanovic-baby-photos-63832|target="_blank") are about to be on their feet a whole lot more chasing after the little one.

Both Karl and Jasmine have been the proudest of parents sharing every milestone eight-month-old Harper has reached with glowing admiration.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Taking to Instagram in September the *Today Show* host celebrated Harper [moving onto solid foods](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/parenting/celebrity-families/karl-stefanovic-daughter-harper-solids-65135|target="_blank"), already coveting avocado as a fave. He then asked fellow parents for advice not just about food but also sleep. 

"The little one has been eyeing off the avocado smash for some time now and yesterday we finally relented. Awww… our little girl is growing up," the 46-year-old said.

"If any of you have any advice on the best solid foods for bubs I'm all ears."
While Karl admitted his youngest was "an absolute joy", like most babies she's "just not sleeping the best at night."

"If you have any advice on sleeping patterns that would be welcome too," Karl asked.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
The 46-year-old recently hit the beach in Port Stephens, NSW, while [holidaying with wife Jasmine](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/parenting/celebrity-families/karl-jasmine-stefanovic-beach-day-66291|target="_blank"), 36 and bub Harper for the festive season. 

Karl shares son Jackson, 21, daughter Ava, 14, and son River, 12, with ex-wife Cassandra Thorburn and in May last year, welcomed daughter Harper with second wife Jasmine.

data.pageTitle: Bump season two on Stan officially announced

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
It's the heartwarming and critically-acclaimed Australian series that audiences have inhaled over the summer holidays. 

And if you're anything like us, after bingeing Stan's original new drama *Bump* you've fallen in love with the story of teen parents Oly and Santi and you no doubt have one thought on your mind: please for the love of baby Jacinda, let there be a second season!

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Well, today the streaming service has finally answered our prayers and confirmed there *will* be a second season of *Bump*.

"*Bump* is the show we needed now - a show that is authentic, full of heart and humour and is testament to our resilience," Claudia Karvan, star, co-creator and producer of *Bump* confirms. 

"We all are champing at the bit to get back into the story room and bring these characters to life again. Stan have been the ultimate collaborators and we're looking forward to working together again," she adds.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Filming for the second season will begin this year with the confirmed cast to be officially announced at a later date.

The 10-part original series centres around Oly (played by Nathalie Morris), an ambitious and high-achieving teenage girl who suddenly finds herself in labour despite being [completely unaware she'd fallen pregnant.](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/tv/bump-nathalie-morris-carlos-sanson-jr-66351|target="_blank")

The drama series stars Claudia Karvan who leads as Oly's mother and also acts as a producer of the series. Angus Sampson (*Fargo*) also appears in the charming series as well as up-and-coming stars, Nathalie Morris and Carlos Sanson Jnr who plays her baby daddy, Santiago.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
So, what potential plot lines can we except to be explored in season two of *Bump*?

"Bernardita starts karate. Madison becomes the CEO of her own moon cup company. Rosa embraces bio-degradable forks. Angie goes celibate. Vince proposes to Santi. Oly develops a crush on Mr Hanover. Baby Jacinda starts talking, a bit like Baby Yoda. All this and more," Claudia Karvan tells *Now To Love* in an exclusive interview. 

There's also a wild theory floating around that Oly's mum Angie could be pregnant following her affair with PE teacher Mr Hernandez after she vomits at the end of J's christening. 

"You're giving us ideas... She also did down a fair amount of beer and shots, that could be the more plausible explanation," Claudia says when we put this to her.

Another character we can expect to see more of is Santi's grandmother Rosa, played by Paula Garcia. The breakout star is the heart and soul of *Bump*, perfectly encapsulating the adoring matriarch role. 

"We were so lucky to find Paula. She had only recently moved to Brisbane from Paris with her family. She's a consummate performer - very experienced, natural and funny. We're looking forward to giving her much more story in series two," Claudia tells us. 

[**Every new show and movie coming to Stan this January 2021, so you can binge watch your way through summer**](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/tv/stan-january-2021-66278|target="_blank")

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
The response to *Bump* has been nothing short of phenomenal, breaking viewing records for Stan since its launch on New Year's Day and for Karvan and her team, she says the positive feedback has been "super gratifying." 

"All our writers, directors and cast are passionate about the show, so to see all their hard work resonant with people is wonderful," she reveals. 

Producer John Edwards says the show has struck a chord because "people love a story that feels true, and where good stuff wins."

*Bump* certainly has the good stuff in spades and we can't wait to see the second season take shape. 

**All episodes of *Bump* are available now to stream on Stan**

data.contentTitle: CONFIRMED: Stan's charming new series Bump will return for a second season… as Claudia Karvan reveals what to expect from the next instalment
data.contentSummary: "Bump is the show we needed now.''
data.pageMetaDescription: It's the heartwarming new series on Stan that has captivated audiences. And in news that will delight fans, a second season of Bump has officially been announced today! Here's everything we know so far.

data.nodeName: Lizzie Sobinoff Seb Guilhaus break up
data.pageTitle: Lizzie Sobinoff & Seb Guilhaus break up after 14 months of dating

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
*Married At First Sight* 2020 saw more drama than any other season but at least we had the sweet love story of returning bride Lizzie Sobinoff and Seb Guilhaus. 

However, the pair have just confirmed that their relationship is over after 14 months of dating.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Taking to Instagram on Monday, the former [*MAFS* couple](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/married-at-first-sight/lizzie-sobinoff-seb-guilhaus-wedding-65232|target="_blank") shared the same photo to their respective Instagram accounts.

"We have mutually decided to end our relationship as boyfriend and girlfriend. We want to thank everyone for the endless support we have received on our platforms," Lizzie and Seb's identical captions read.

They went on to urge followers: "Please be kind and respectful. We are aware you have followed parts of our journey, but please remember we are real people, and we are both navigating our way through this time to the best of our abilities.

"Naturally we are both aware there will be countless rumours and so on. Again, we are both navigating our way through this time so please be respectful and we won't be allowing comments on this post. It is still fresh for us both, we just know there has been some curiosity as we have shared parts of our relationship online and we met on national television."

The reality stars ended their posts: "We are both respectful of each other and are still involved in each other's lives. We both have cherished each other and have grown together. We would like to send love and well wishes to all."

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Lizzie and Seb's [attraction was instant](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/married-at-first-sight/mafs-are-lizzie-and-seb-still-together-63710|target="_blank") when they met at the altar and were the only couple to leave the experiment together.

Returning bride Lizzie came back for a second shot after her disastrous match with Sam Ball in the previous season who ended up cheating on her with co-star, Ines Basic.

The couple faced their fair share of challenges throughout their relationship. When the coronavirus pandemic first kicked off, the couple's plans to move in together were put on hold and the two tackled a long-distance relationship - Lizzie was isolating in her hometown of Newcastle whilst Seb was in his hometown Adelaide.

"It's definitely not easy, and we both thrive on physical touch. So that's a bit of a downer, because we can't do that right now," she told 9Entertainment in May 2020 of being apart from Seb.

Personal trainer Seb however added that their phone conversations have been the couple's "bread and butter".

"We've gotten closer, we've strengthened our bond, but we do still reach out for physical touch," he explained.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Back in September the couple [fuelled engagement rumours](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/married-at-first-sight/mafs-lizzie-pregnant-seb-63245|target="_blank") when they exchanged rings with each other's initials inscribed on them.  

"He said to me 'Is it S & L ?' I said 'Yeah, baby' @seb.guilhaus Corny but I love it," Lizzie captioned a photo of their matching jewellery on Instagram.

Fans quickly took to the comments section and it didn't take long for some to ask if a wedding was on the cards. 

"Can he put it on your left finger already 🙄 haha your story is actually the best thing ever to come out of MAFS," one fan joked, 

"Best couple hope u marry too," penned another.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
There are now only three remaining MAFS couples out of 60 of the experts' pairings that are still together.

Season two's Erin Bateman and Bryce Mohr who met on the 2016 season are the franchise's longest-lasting couple whilst season six saw the successful matchings of Jules Robinson and Cam Merchant as well as Martha Kalifatidis and Michael Brunelli.

In fact, Jules and Cam have made their love official and tied the knot for real in November 2019. 

**This article first appeared on our sister site, [Who](https://www.who.com.au/mafs-lizzie-sobinoff-seb-guilhaus-break-up|target="_blank").**

data.contentTitle: Married at first, split at second: In devastating news for reality TV land, Lizzie Sobinoff and Seb Guilhaus have split up
data.contentSummaryTitle: MAFS' Lizzie Sobinoff and Seb Guilhaus split
data.pageMetaDescription: Married At First Sight 2020 saw more drama than any other season but at least we had the sweet love story of returning bride Lizzie Sobinoff and Seb Guilhaus. However, the pair have just confirmed that their relationship is over after 14 months of dating.

data.pageTitle: Studio 10’s Tristan MacManus suffered two heart attacks

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
When you think of someone suffering a heart attack, that thought is usually synonymous with old age, poor health and obesity. 

However, that's not always the case. 

It certainly wasn't for 38-year-old *Dancing With The Stars* turned *Studio 10* star Tristan MacManus who has revealed he suffered not one but two terrifying attacks.

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
"I woke up and I was on the ground," Tristan told [*Sydney Confidential*](https://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/studio-10s-tristan-mcmanus-on-heart-attack-no2-three-strikes-and-you-are-out/news-story/636957d890b9934384513bf619e7f3de|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow") of his first heart attack which he experienced at just 26-years-old while dancing in Las Vegas. 

"To be honest, they didn't really tell me there was anything wrong with my heart so I didn't really think anything of it."

The TV host's grandfather had died of heart attack at age 36, the same age at which he then suffered his second attack. 

"I just started beating my chest, I could feel my heart in my head. I felt tingles down my arms."

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
It was then, two years ago now, that Tristan was told he'd had a second heart attack and was diagnosed with myopericarditis, which is inflammation of the heart muscle and the pericardium.

"Your arteries are supposed to sit on top of your heart, it turns out mine go through my heart."

Despite living with the fear he could suffer another attack at anytime, only managing the disease by staying on top of his health, his main [concern is his children](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/dancing-with-the-stars/tristan-mcmanus-family-62487|target="_blank").

contentBody.label: Paragraph
contentBody.content:
Tristan and [wife Tahyna Tozzi](https://www.nowtolove.com.au/reality-tv/dancing-with-the-stars/dancing-with-the-stars-judge-tristan-macmanus-tahyna-tozzi-54255|target="_blank") of *Blue Water High* fame, share four-year-old daughter Echo and one-year-old son Oisin and have a third child due in April.

"There will always be that fear. I couldn't think of anything else that would be more scary than not seeing my kids grow up."

"Three strikes and you're out."

data.contentTitle: Studio 10’s Tristan MacManus reveals he suffered two deadly heart attacks before turning 36
data.contentSummaryTitle: Studio 10’s Tristan MacManus suffered two heart attacks
data.pageMetaDescription: Studio 10’s Tristan MacManus reveals he suffered two deadly heart attacks before turning 36. His biggest fear lies not in suffering a third but leaving his kids without a dad.
